intro: Boerhavia schinzii f. villosa, commonly known as the hairy boerhavia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Nyctaginaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and thrives in well-drained soils. This species is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
